Function Documentation

void eol_particle_emitter_from_config ( eolConfig *  config,
eolVec3D  point,
eolVec3D  rotation,
eolVec3D  color,
eolFloat  alpha 
)

here is a list of options that may occur in the config:

Parameters:
entityLiftime how long the entity should live
entityRotationVector change of entity rotation
entityColorVector change in color for entity
entityAlphaVector change in alpha for entity
type [point, sprite, actor]
actor path to the actor to use for this particle
count uint how many particles are to be created (for entity, this is per update)
lifetime uint how long the particles should live before timing out in server ticks
lifetimeVariance float how much variation should be applied to lifetime
shape [point|square|circle|sphere] shape of the creation point for the particles
vector vec3D direction the particles should move in (0,0,0 is viable)
vectorVariance vec3D percentage that the vector will vary by component
accelation vec3D direction the particles will acclerate in (0,0,0 is viable)
AccelVariance vec3D percentage that the acceleration will vary by component
color vec3D the default color that this should be (will be multiplied by input color)
colorVariance vec3D percentage that the color will vary by component
colorVector vec3D change in color over time
colorVector vec3D change in color over time
alpha float transparecy
alphaVariance float percentage that the alpha will vary by component
alphaVector float change in alpha over time
drawTrail 
trailTaper 
trailFade spawn a bunch of particles based on a config setup
config the loaded config file that contains the particle emitter info
point the point where all the particles should be created from
rotation the direction the particles will move in (factors of config will affect this)
color the color the particles should be (config will affect this)
alpha the transparency of the particles created (config affects this)

Definition at line 34 of file eol_particle_emitter.c.

eolEntity* eol_particle_spawn_emitter_from_config ( eolLine  configfile,
eolVec3D  point,
eolVec3D  vector,
eolVec3D  rotation,
eolVec3D  color,
eolFloat  alpha 
)

spawn an entity that will emit particles over its lifetime based on a config setup

Parameters:
configfile the file to load for the config
point the point where all the particles should be created from
vector the direction the entity will move in
color the color the particles should be (config will affect this)
alpha the transparency of the particles created (config affects this)
Returns:
a pointer to the set up entity or NULL on error. NOTE: the entity will not be added to any space for collision, as particles tend not to interact. You are given the pointer to the entity to do with what you will however.
